Reviews.Content: loved our time there wat a great time we had there , people great , service great ,food great , accomadation good , clean and airconditioned , we will be back there again sanur great .
Reviews.Author: littlemooka

Reviews.Content: The Good  Week 1 Besakih Hotel Sanur.For the price this hotel is fine but it could do with a few minor updates to the rooms to make it even better. That breakfast that everyone goes on about, all we can say is it was plenty to fill you up, the only down side to the hotel is they do not provide tea and coffee with the electric jug and cups that are in your room (bit strange that) also they do not replace the initial supply of soap etc. The rooms are made up while you are at breakfast that is a big plus. The staff were very friendly. The following are the restaurants that we eat at Mangos very good as usual, Bennos very good, Laser Bar not so good, Besakih good but pricey,Aladdins had to be the best and for a cheap light snack for lunch try the Circle K.For all of those things that we stock in the fridge Hardy's is the place or at least that is until you check out Carrefour's, it is worth just going there to take a pic with the guys on the roller blades and this place has the best fresh cooked bakery you would ever need and the prices are so cheap. Whilst on the big Super Stores, Mataharies at Legian is no longer and the Mateharies at Kuta is left for dead by the Centro Discouvery Plaza but be warned there are no cheap things there. We enjoyed our stay at Sanur and will be back sometime in the future.Sorry for ranting on but that is me, I tell as I see it.Happy Travels
Reviews.Author: AB1951

Reviews.Content: Besakih Beach Resort - Loved it!!! My partner and I stayed at the Besakih, it was our first time to Bali and I have to say we loved it!! The rooms were fairly old, but cleaned everyday with fresh towels and sheets. We weren't too fussed about that anyway as we were only in the room when we were sleeping. The staff were all helpful and very friendly. The restaurant which is overlooking the beach was great, and we did not have one bad meal there. The great thing about Bali is that you can eat great food for a cheap price!!  Apparently Sanur and the Besakih is for older people, but we found that there was a range of ages, from 20 through to 80. This place is great for people who are after a more quiet, relaxed pace then Kuta, and though Sanur is still fairly busy its less hectic and full on. We'll be going back for sure :) Reccommend - There is a place called Hardy', a little shopping centre, out the front they have drivers, ask for Damic. He is good value and provides transport at a good price.
Reviews.Author: Tex08

Reviews.Content: Tired Besakih but help is on its way We have just returned from a three resort stay in Bali visiting Ubud, Sanur and Tuban. The three resorts were all priced around the same give or take $10 a night AUD.The Besakih however came in at an extremely poor 3rd place when it came to accomodation. This is our 3rd trip to the Besakih and there has been no change to the room type we stayed in since we first went in 1997 and even then they were only average. It really is quite poor. The Besakih however is currently undergoing a refurbishment with some rooms having already being completed and although I did not see one from the inside they do look very good from the outside.I have no idea when they will all be completed.The location of the resort is what could make this appealing In my opinion the best located in Sanur. It is central to shops and restaurants.The food prices are reasonable and breakfast is good but as in all resorts of this rating you will virtually see the same on the menu every day.One other thing I must mention is this is very much a older persons resort if you are young and considering here you may well be dissapointed.It is frequented by older people who visit every year. I suspect that these are priority in getting the refurbished rooms.( Is that right or wrong ?or do we all pay the same ? )All the staff at the Besakih are wonderful very friendly and helpfull and will do anything to try and make your stay enjoyable.
Reviews.Author: delboyPerth

Reviews.Content: Loved the Besakih We have just returned from 7 days at the Besakih and I can highly recommend this hotel. It is situated on what I believe to be the best position on Sanur Beach. Close to shops, restaurants, convenience store and markets. It is on a lovely stretch of beach, whereas other hotels have very little beachfront when the tide comes in. The horizon pool is absolute beachfront and you can swim in the pool and gaze at Mt Agung in the distance. The hotel is frequented by regular older clients who have been coming here for 30 years. The advantage of this to my 2 teenagers was that they had the pools to themselves at most times, the older guests preferring to just laze about the beach or pool and read all day. There were a few younger couples and little ones about and all guests seem to get on well.The only downside was that the hotel is being refurbished at the moment and there was a fair bit of noise, for which the manager personally apologized for. Rooms are quite large with nice verandahs, but the bathrooms not so good, being very mouldy. I figured that I probably only spend 1 hour out of 24 in the bathroom, so it wasnt such a big deal, unfortunately they dont seem to have included bathroom renovations in the refurbishment. I believe they will be raising the prices by 10% when the refurbishment is complete. Staff were all lovely and we knew most of them by name after 7 days. They also have 2 pet dogs and a cat which made my kids feel like they were at home. We loved Sanur, a lovely way to settle into Bali, much quieter than the other side of the island. Would I return to the Besakih, definately and look forward to doing so in the future.
Reviews.Author: KateCaringbah

Reviews.Content: Best in sanur Just returned from our third stay in sanur .We love Besakih and wanted to take ours kids aged 17 and 15.They had a fantasic time in the beautiful pool overlooking the beach,Most of the rooms have been renovated and look great we had connecting rooms (223-224)The gardens were kept so neat and tidy,the staff were very friendly.The breakfast at the hotel was good ,eggs anyway you like,fruit,fruit juices,toast,pastries.Lunch by the pool was so relaxing.Very close to some great resturants we loved Bonsai right on the beach and Mades on the street.Shopping was fun some ladies drove you crazy wanting you to go to their shop but after a couple of days they left you aloneEverything was so cheap food drinks and clothes dvd were good as wellIts the only place in sanur we would stay,and we plan to return soon I will be recommending it to all my friends and familyGreat Hoilday
Reviews.Author: Leanne77Melbourne

Reviews.Content: Very Disappointed Was very disappointed - first trip to Bali. Had tried to book into a couple of other hotel/resorts but they seem to have been booked. First trip to Bali and first holiday with just my husband and I after 23 years of bringing children up. We arrived at 9pm, taken to our room, two single beds!! So i said that the booking must have been wrong we asked for a double room - we were then put in the most grotty room i have ever seen in my life - bathroom was absolutely disgusting. Previously to leaving for Bali i had a horrible feeling after the travel Agent had booked 4 nights and I went back in and changed it to one night (having to pay a little for the nights we were not staying) - best thing we ever did (I must have known). Took a walk the next morning and booked an absolutely beautiful hotel for the same price. A happy ending!
Reviews.Author: wannago58

Reviews.Content: best holiday ever       relax
Reviews.Author: jorgotnt

Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel!       Bedroom
Reviews.Author: cwmmh

Reviews.Content: M.A  This is really terrible if you have been in the rest of Bali. At the reception they are very nice, but the rooms are old, the staff in the restaurant are very unfriendly. If you like this you haven鈥檛 seen Bali, you haven鈥檛 really met de local people and you haven鈥檛 felt the real hospitality of the Bali people.The beach and the pool are nice but that鈥檚 about it. We booked this hotel looking at tripadvisor and we saw only good reviews and booked immediately and we were so disappointed. We saw Lombok and Bali and we wanted a few days to relax at the beach before we went toYokjakarta. We have seen a lot of places and booked guesthouses and luxury hotels al over Bali and Lombok. But this hotel got nothing special 鈥︹€? no hart.If you only take this hotel for one night, no problem. If you want to stay her for at least 8 days, as the most people there did. Be prepared to do a lot of day trips and ignore the staff in the restaurant, but that is hard to do, ignoring the staff.Advise find something else, it鈥檚 your holiday
Reviews.Author: TheNetherlandsJacobs

Reviews.Content: Not that great at all! After reading all the good reviews below on the Besakih hotel, me and my boyfriend (30/32 yrs, from Holland) decided to book for 6 nights ($45, lucky to get a bungalow). Already the first day we knew we were not going to survive 6 nights at this Besakih Hotel. The main reason was that we were the only young people among big groups of 70+ years old ladies. Our driver later confirmed that this were the regular visitors of this hotel. The quality of the food and staff in the restaurant was really poor. The real season did not even start yet, but they seemed to be annoyed by every quest. Besides this you have to be aware that Sanur as a city attracts tourists who do not leave their hotel for 10 days, make pictures of the traditional Balinese dancing girls performing in their restaurant and then believe they have seen Bali. So looking at the Island in front of Sanur, we dramatically changed our plans the second day and took the first Peramatour boat to Nusa Lembongan, and had a great stay at a secluded 'dream beach' for RP150.000 only. To give you some positives on Besakih: nice and friendly staff at reception, and cleaning force basic, out dated, but o.k. rooms with a nice shower good beachesIf I would advice another hotel in Sanur it would probalby be 'the Taverne'. But this is only based on the experience of some other dutch we met. Cheers, and enjoy Bali
Reviews.Author: josine

Reviews.Content: Disappointed in Besakih After reading all the reviews on Besakih, I booked two rooms for my family and arrived last week. We live in Indonesia and travel to Bali fairly often as our first holiday destination be it for a quick weekend or longer. Arriving we were greeted warmly by two reception staff who were very friendly thus first impressions were favourable. Shown to our rooms, two standard rooms in the old hotel part, in fact just a few doors down from the reception area itself on the ground floor. Walking into the room, the first thing we noticed was a very strong pervasive musty smell. Turned on the air conditioner and hoped it would go away. No such luck. The mattress had such a strong mouldy odour that neither of us got much sleep that night. The room was basic, clean, tidy but once you were inside you could be anywhere, it had all the elements of a standard hotel room anywhere in the world. That is to say, absolutely no character at all. We could have been in a motel room in outback Australia. Floor tiles were cracked and stained, furniture well past their use by date, and the bathroom was, to put it mildly, decrepit. Stained tiles and bathtub, ageing taps, dirty yellow/grey grouting etc. The radio/power system set into the bedside table didn't work (so why leave it there?), a door at the back of the room, locked but obviously was a concern. The good thing was that between our two rooms was a connecting door near the entrance door thus facilitating access to our young children鈥檚 room. Stepping onto the balcony we were faced with a brick wall a metre or so away so not the nicest view when relaxing. My wife wanted to charge her mobile phone and went to reception to ask for a double adaptor. The person behind the counter (a new one who was not there when we checked in) told her to go buy one if you need one. So she went out and bought one, only some time later a porter turned up and gave her one they had found. The next morning I woke early and wandered down to the restaurant and asked for a coffee. I was given instant coffee. Usually most hotels in Bali will serve the delicious 'Bali coffee' . The pool on first glance was very inviting, looking out over the beach and the sea. Closer inspection found it to be covered with a thin film of dust. However, later in the day I sat by it and while it was a lovely view, to get a drink one had to go over the bridge, down some steps, step up onto the raised restaurant floor, wait for the group of staff sitting around chatting to notice you, wait for a drink, ask for a stubby holder, (this caused a few annoyed looks cast my way), one grudgingly found and dusted off, and then back to the pool again. The pool bar was not in operation and looked as if it hadn鈥檛 been for some time. After the bad nights sleep, an uninspiring room and poor lacklustre service we had had enough. There are heaps of hotels to choose from along the beach strip. We checked out and moved a few doors down to the Gazebo, paying less for a two bedroom, two bathroom, private courtyard, free standing cottage looking out onto a beautiful garden. Big clean rooms, delightfully and distinctively Balinese in design. We stayed at the Gazebo for a further four nights before heading back home. If you really want to enjoy Balinese hospitality, good food, good service and rooms, try the Gazebo. Besakih falls far short for what they charge. However, the pool is invitingly situated with a lovely aspect. Shame about the rest.
Reviews.Author: Aussiexpat

Reviews.Content: Besakih is Great Mate The Besakih in Sanur is a great place to stay, its location on the Sanur beach is perfect, with choices of many restaurants and shops either on the beach or back on the road from which to choose.The Hotels rooms seem somewhat dated but are kept clean by a very friendly group of staff who will go the extra mile to ensure your stay is is a happy one.I must admit to getting confused as to what Hotel to choose for our 6 night stay in Sanur, so i started reading Trip Advisor Reports on all the potentials. Reading between the lines of other advisors i deducted that if you want a pristine, brand new hotel with limited charecter, then choose elsewhere. But if you want to feel the essence of Bali in clean older rooms with clean but dated bathrooms(how long do you spend in bathrooms any way?), well manicured gardens in a quiet environment, friendly staff and a Pool in a position to die for, then the Besakih is probably your best choice.
Reviews.Author: ASBGeelong

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great location Very good hotel: good food, location. Comfy beach area with shade and a pool on the edge of the property facing the beach. Reasonably priced. Bungalows have a better view (of the garden) than std hotel rooms.
Reviews.Author: travman999

Reviews.Content: Besakih Hotel - a Sanur beachside treasure My partner and I have just returned from 5 amazing days at this beautiful beachside hotel.There may be more modern hotels along the Sanur beachfront but to us this hotel encapsulated the spirit of Bali - beautiful garden surroundings, relaxed, comfortable, non pretentious, outstanding service and friendly staff who were prepared to go the extra mile (the poor chef was asleep on the beach one night and they woke him at 10pm to make us pancakes! - he was on duty but was so obliging and friendly.The location is amazing - right on the Sanur beachfront, easy walking distance to markets and shops, and many many fantastic restaurants.The room we stayed in was a bit tired, but very clean and well serviced every day - aircon was brilliant. Clean but old bathroom - shower in bath. Comfy bed. Specify if you want a double bed as most seem to be two singles. We were moved immediately when we requested a double bed. Good patio area with clothes rack. Very cheap and reliable laundry service.Good internet service and exceptionally helpful front office staff. Make sure you take advantage of the safety deposit box facility at the front desk. There's a little library where guests leave their books once they leave - great recycling and interesting range of reading tastes. My partner found a great book on the flowers of Bali and was able to identify the many many flowers in the extensive and lush gardens of the hotel. Fountains scattered throughout the gardens with water lilies and lotus flowers add to the ambience of the place.What really makes the Besakih special (apart from all of the above!) is its amazing infinity pool, right on the beachfront - we saw quite a few of the other hotels on our walks and this was definitely the best location in our book. Lying beside the pool looking out to the reef and the volcanoes in the distance is a truly relaxing experience.Note that the swim up pool bar operates a bit erratically and the spa is not working at the moment. Minor problems though, and the restaurant is very happy to bring food and drinks to the poolside.The food in the restaurant was excellent and very well priced - try the fish curry and the satay. Breakfast was extremely good - choice of western or Indonesian breakfast with fresh fruit and you can ask for a very good mixed omelette.We stayed in a standard room (downstairs) and there are also bungalows that look pretty good. We thought the ones numbered 223 to 226 were the best location - apparently the bungalows don't cost any more than rooms.There are also two new Classic bungalows that cost a bit more and are more upmarket (brochure price was US150). While they are very nice, we prefer the older style.The hotel indicated that they were very willing to negotiate on price and suggested we contact them directly by email next time.The Besakih really suited our needs and tastes, but may not suit you if you are looking for something very upmarket and modern. We will definitely return here next Easter.
Reviews.Author: SallyRBrisbane

Reviews.Content: You must stay here This hotel was fantasic value for money. Right on the beach  very close to markets, many great beach front restaurants. Rooms were nice but we spent most of our time at the beachside pool. Staff were very friendly  helpful  honest. Beautiful grounds  a beachside restaurant. We also stayed at Legian but would definately stay at Besakih again. We were in a two story thatched roof bungalow but the rooms looked nice too.
Reviews.Author: AliJAustralia

Reviews.Content: Besakih Beach Resort is the perfect getaway       Pool at Besakih
Reviews.Author: jan.kirk

Reviews.Content: Great Location on the Beach Located on the beach, there was a lovely breeze blowing to keep things cool. We were in a Bungalow with a verandah the other guests and staff were all very friendly. Ricky the manager was absolutely fantastic when I took sick nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. I would highly recommend this fantastic place to anyone. The food at the restaurant was good and well priced. The swimming pools were wonderful, you could lean against the side and watch the world go bye on the beach only metres away.
Reviews.Author: bozlady

Reviews.Content: Love Sanur! Love Besakih Hotel! Love the shopping! When our son told us he was getting married in Bali we were less than enthusiastic. However, we have just returned from 8 glorious - picture perfect - relaxing and stress free days in Bali. On top of that it was really inexpensive! The wedding was beautiful, the staff at Besakih Beach Hotel went out of their way to ensure that our new daughter-in-law had the day she had dreamed of. The Besakih was a great hotel, after a week most of the staff new us by name - and all had great joy teaching me snippets of Balinese! We had swims at midnight in the pool - surface covered with floating frangipanis (courtesy of nearby trees) - it was glorious. Lunch at the swim-up bar - didn't even have to get out of the pool! Everything was beautiful - I would be back there tomorrow if I could be!Some tips for good shopping - once you have purchased an item - like a necklace or a sarong - wear it next time you go shopping. The hawkers will try to sell you more - will ask how much you paid - and offer to sell for less. Tell them what price you want - we tended to get things for less than half the price we purchased the first necklace or sarong for! Was much easier than cold haggling - the hawkers knew we had some experience. They will often try to take you for a ride if they know you have just arrived. Just tell them you have been there for a week even if you have just arrived! And you have already bought too many/much. If it is your first purchase - aim to get the item for roughtly half their initial price. It really helped me to write a rough conversion sheet on a business card and kept it in my purse - so you know roughly how much money you are talking about when haggling. Work out in your head what you want to pay - but don't be too tough - these people are really struggling with the lack of tourists. Although several times I had to walk off before getting what I wanted for the right price.
Reviews.Author: phillandsuzi

Reviews.Content: wonderful as you can see i was at besakih quite a long time ago, we had booked into another resort which was further back from the beach, and even though it was lovely it was too hot, my friend did a bit of exploring and found besakih over the road, and with the sea breeze it was perfect, the rooms are very clean, we had a bungalow at the front by the pool which was wonderful, the staff are fantastic, as are some of the long term residents, as the other post said, it is self contained but just a short walk along the beach to great little eating/hanging out places- i'm getting nostalgic just thinking about it, and hope to stay again at besakih in 2007. sanur is just right if you want a relaxed holiday with the option of going into the 'busy side of town'. besakih, in my opinion is the best.
Reviews.Author: doona

Reviews.Content: Great Cheap Beach front hotel 10/10 I have stayed at Besakih twice, as you can see the last time was quiet a while ago! Though most people in my family go twice a year and usually stay at besakih.I have just heard they have renovated!!!This is a lovely hotel, beautiful little bungalows set in fantastic gardens. Most are positioned so you can sit outside of your room in privacy injoying the garden. They also have two story bungalows and some rooms near the front entrance. I recommend the single bungalows. NO NEIGHBOURS!The bungalows are basic, they have phones, TV's, fridges  ensuites. Very Clean. The staff are beautiful, typical balanesse. I prefer this to a flashy hotel as you can be yourself. You can dress how you like and relax.The pool is to die for, they even have a bar in there. Its right on the beach and next to the resturant, you don't even have to leave the resort if you don't want to. It's location is also great, it's just a short stoll along the beach to the local markets. If you want to eat out of your hotel, there are resturants on the beach or you can go out into the street. There are a few good resturants within walking distance or there is an endless supply of bemo drivers to take you.Outside the hotel there are alot of different shops along the street and a supermarketSanur is a great place to stay if you want a relaxing holiday, if you want a full on shopping/partying experience then it may be a bit quiet for you! Though they do have some good bars and nightclub.I'm hoping to go to bali soon, will deffinately stay here! Hopefully it will still be the same as my review as it has been a while :)
Reviews.Author: Evershine
